title: Getting started
text: spotify R package. installed, package can loaded attached current workspace follows: helpful libraries.
code: library(spotify) library(ggplot2)

title: Getting started
code: input_file <- system.file(package = "spotify", "Kevin.jpg")

title: Getting started
code: kevin <- spotify(   path = input_file ) print(kevin) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   format width height colorspace matte filesize density #>   <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr>      <lgl>    <int> <chr>   #> 1 WEBP    1140   1140 sRGB       FALSE    69414 72x72

title: Getting started
code: kevin <- spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "flatten",   extras = list(     image_flatten = list(operator = "Modulate")   ) ) print(kevin) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   format width height colorspace matte filesize density #>   <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr>      <lgl>    <int> <chr>   #> 1 WEBP    1140   1140 sRGB       FALSE        0 72x72

title: Getting started
code: kevin <- spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "data" ) kevin #> 3 channel 1140x1140 bitmap array: 'bitmap' raw [1:3, 1:1140, 1:1140] ff ff ff ff ...

title: Getting started
code: kevin <- spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "matrix" ) dim(kevin) #> [1] 1140 1140

title: Getting started
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "heatmap" )

title: Getting started
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "point",   downsample = 100 ) + theme_void()

title: Getting started
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "jitter",   downsample = 100,   jitter = 5 ) + theme_void()

title: Getting started
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "spatial",   downsample = 75,   jitter = 5,   extras = list(     cluster = list(k.nn = 50, k.cluster = 10)   ) ) + theme_void() + guides(colour = "none")

title: Getting started
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "visium",   downsample = 100,   point.size = 0.25,   extras = list(     cluster = list(k.nn = 50, k.cluster = 10)   ) ) + theme_void() + guides(colour = "none")

title: Getting started
text: GitHub repository contains development version package, new functionality added time. authors appreciate well-considered suggestions improvements new features, even better, pull requests. use spotify analysis, please cite shown :
code: citation("spotify") #> To cite package 'spotify' in publications use: #>  #>   Rue-Albrecht K (2024). _spotify: Spotify Your Images_. R package #>   version 0.1.0, <https://kevinrue.github.io/spotify>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {spotify: Spotify Your Images}, #>     author = {Kevin Rue-Albrecht}, #>     year = {2024}, #>     note = {R package version 0.1.0}, #>     url = {https://kevinrue.github.io/spotify}, #>   }

title: Radcliffe Camera
text: spotify R package. installed, package can loaded attached current workspace follows: helpful libraries.
code: library(spotify) library(ggplot2)

title: Radcliffe Camera
code: input_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".jpg") dir.create(dirname(input_file)) download.file(url = "https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipOCPWTCh3keAMBioweiqUf0PZHOaxIUCekJThB9=s1360-w1360-h1020", destfile = input_file)

title: Radcliffe Camera
code: spatial_thing <- spotify(   path = input_file ) print(spatial_thing) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   format width height colorspace matte filesize density #>   <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr>      <lgl>    <int> <chr>   #> 1 JPEG    1209   1020 sRGB       FALSE   377244 72x72

title: Radcliffe Camera
code: spatial_thing <- spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "flatten",   extras = list(     image_flatten = list(operator = "Modulate")   ) ) print(spatial_thing) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   format width height colorspace matte filesize density #>   <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr>      <lgl>    <int> <chr>   #> 1 JPEG    1209   1020 sRGB       FALSE        0 72x72

title: Radcliffe Camera
code: spatial_thing <- spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "data" ) spatial_thing #> 3 channel 1209x1020 bitmap array: 'bitmap' raw [1:3, 1:1209, 1:1020] ff ff ff ff ...

title: Radcliffe Camera
code: spatial_thing <- spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "matrix" ) dim(spatial_thing) #> [1] 1209 1020

title: Radcliffe Camera
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "heatmap" )

title: Radcliffe Camera
code: spatial_thing <- spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "xy" ) head(spatial_thing) #>     x  y #> 1 156 -1 #> 2 190 -1 #> 3 260 -1 #> 4 315 -1 #> 5 322 -1 #> 6 359 -1

title: Radcliffe Camera
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "point",   downsample = 100 ) + theme_void()

title: Radcliffe Camera
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "jitter",   downsample = 100,   jitter = 5 ) + theme_void()

title: Radcliffe Camera
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "spatial",   downsample = 150,   jitter = 3,   point.size = 0.5,   extras = list(     cluster = list(k.nn = 50, k.cluster = 9)   ) ) +    coord_cartesian(ylim = c(NA, -90)) +   theme_void() + guides(colour = "none") +   scale_colour_brewer(palette = "Paired")

title: Radcliffe Camera
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "visium",   downsample = 200,   point.size = 0.1,   extras = list(     cluster = list(k.nn = 50, k.cluster = 10)   ) ) +    coord_cartesian(ylim = c(NA, -90)) +   theme_void() + guides(colour = "none") +   scale_colour_brewer(palette = "Paired")

title: Radcliffe Camera

title: Spotify Yourself
text: spotify R package. installed, package can loaded attached current workspace follows: helpful libraries.
code: library(spotify) library(ggplot2)

title: Spotify Yourself
code: input_file <- system.file(package = "spotify", "spotify.jpg")

title: Spotify Yourself
code: kevin <- spotify(   path = input_file ) print(kevin) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   format width height colorspace matte filesize density #>   <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr>      <lgl>    <int> <chr>   #> 1 JPEG     939    940 sRGB       FALSE    66798 300x300

title: Spotify Yourself
code: kevin <- spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "flatten",   extras = list(     image_flatten = list(operator = "Modulate")   ) ) print(kevin) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   format width height colorspace matte filesize density #>   <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr>      <lgl>    <int> <chr>   #> 1 JPEG     939    940 sRGB       FALSE        0 300x300

title: Spotify Yourself
code: kevin <- spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "data" ) kevin #> 3 channel 939x940 bitmap array: 'bitmap' raw [1:3, 1:939, 1:940] 00 00 00 00 ...

title: Spotify Yourself
code: kevin <- spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "matrix",   invert = TRUE ) dim(kevin) #> [1] 939 940

title: Spotify Yourself
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "heatmap",   invert = TRUE )

title: Spotify Yourself
code: kevin <- spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "xy",   invert = TRUE ) head(kevin) #>      x   y #> 6  451 -15 #> 12 457 -15 #> 18 463 -15 #> 24 469 -15 #> 31 476 -15 #> 37 482 -15

title: Spotify Yourself
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "point",   invert = TRUE,   downsample = 100 ) + theme_void()

title: Spotify Yourself
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "jitter",   invert = TRUE,   downsample = 100,   jitter = 5 ) + theme_void()

title: Spotify Yourself
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "spatial",   invert = TRUE,   downsample = 75,   jitter = 5,   extras = list(     cluster = list(k.nn = 50, k.cluster = 10)   ) ) + theme_void() + guides(colour = "none")

title: Spotify Yourself
code: spotify(   path = input_file,   return.type = "visium",   invert = TRUE,   downsample = 100,   point.size = 0.25,   extras = list(     cluster = list(k.nn = 50, k.cluster = 10)   ) ) + theme_void() + guides(colour = "none")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rue-Albrecht K (2025). spotify: Spotify Images. R package version 0.1.0, https://kevinrue.github.io/spotify.
code: @Manual{,   title = {spotify: Spotify Your Images},   author = {Kevin Rue-Albrecht},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://kevinrue.github.io/spotify}, }

title: Spotify Your Images
text: spotify package provides functionality read image files produce plots simulate spatial omics data (e.g., 10x Genomics Visium Xenium).

title: Spotify Your Images
text: spatalist can easily installed GitHub using remotes::install_github():
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("kevinrue/spotify")

title: Spotify Your Images
text: Please note spotify project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Title — cluster
code: cluster(xy, extras = list())

title: Title — cluster
text: xy Data frame. extras List additional parameters. See Details.

title: Convert Image to Matrix — firstLayerNotWhite
code: firstLayerNotWhite(img_data)

title: Convert Image to Matrix — firstLayerNotWhite
code: library(magick) #> Linking to ImageMagick 6.9.12.98 #> Enabled features: fontconfig, freetype, fftw, heic, lcms, pango, raw, webp, x11 #> Disabled features: cairo, ghostscript, rsvg #> Using 4 threads  img <- system.file(package = "spotify", "Kevin.jpg") img_raw <- image_read(path = img) img_data <- image_data(img_raw) is.matrix(firstLayerNotWhite(img_data)) #> [1] TRUE

code: make_heatmap(matrix(sample(0:1, size = 100, replace = TRUE), nrow = 10))

text: xy_coord `data.frame` XY coordinates. jitter Amount jitter.

code: make_jitter(data.frame(x = 1, y = 1))

title: Spatial Plot — make_spatial
text: xy_coord `data.frame` XY coordinates. point.size Point size

title: Spatial Plot — make_spatial
code: make_jitter(data.frame(x = 1, y = 1))

title: Spotify Images — spotify
code: spotify(   path,   return.type = c("raw", "flatten", "data", "matrix", "heatmap", "xy", "point", "jitter",     "spatial", "visium"),   downsample = 150,   jitter = 1,   point.size = 1,   img2matrix.FUN = firstLayerNotWhite,   invert = FALSE,   extras = list() )

title: Spotify Images — spotify
text: path Path input file. return.type Type image return. downsample Integer resolution `FALSE`. jitter Amount jitter. point.size Point size img2matrix.FUN Function converting image data matrix. invert Use negative image. extras List options sub-functions.

title: Spotify Images — spotify
code: kevin <- spotify(   path = system.file(package = "spotify", "Kevin.jpg") ) print(kevin) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   format width height colorspace matte filesize density #>   <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr>      <lgl>    <int> <chr>   #> 1 WEBP    1140   1140 sRGB       FALSE    69414 72x72    kevin <- spotify(   path = system.file(package = "spotify", "Kevin.jpg"),   return.type = "flatten",   extras = list(     image_flatten = list(operator = "Threshold")   ) ) print(kevin) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   format width height colorspace matte filesize density #>   <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr>      <lgl>    <int> <chr>   #> 1 WEBP    1140   1140 sRGB       FALSE        0 72x72
